definition: to invest in stock/to buy shares

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: Economic weakness is leaching into their stock portfolios.
sentences.chinese: 人們的股票投資組合也受到了經濟疲軟的侵蝕。

sentences.english: They're investing in stocks or dying their hair purple.
sentences.chinese: 他們在做股票投資或把頭髮染成紫色。

sentences.english: Long-term stock investments can pay off.
sentences.chinese: 長期的股票投資能有所回報。

sentences.english: The dividend will fluctuate depending on the success or failure of the stock purchased.
sentences.chinese: 馬卡斯很高興看到他的股票投資每季有這麼高的股利。

sentences.english: That store can be a pail of gold, a portfolio of stock, or assets.
sentences.chinese: 儲存的財富可以是黃金，股票投資組合或是資產。

sentences.english: That's their complete stock investment strategy.
sentences.chinese: 這就是他們全部的股票投資策略。

definition: hook (on which to hang sth)/to couple/to link together/to establish contact with/hook/coupling links (e.g. between two railway coaches)
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
